snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, developers and unions hope to renew the 421-a program to give tax breaks to builders who include subsidized units in luxury projects in New York City....
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo strikes deal with real estate developers and union construction officials to revive program known as 421-a in order to build more apartments for poor and working-class New Yorkers; program, if approved, will give developers tax cuts if they set aside subsidized apartments in luxury properties.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, developers and unions hope to renew the 421-a program to give tax breaks to builders who include subsidized units in luxury projects in New York City.

headline.main: Cuomo Strikes Deal to Revive Affordable Housing Program
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Strikes Deal to Revive Affordable Housing Plan

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Real Estate Board of New York
